author: benjaminion
content:
<@!448487395189587969> Anything involving shards is Phase 1 ðŸ˜„  But here are some answers, anyway...
Preamble: There are 32 slots per epoch, and 64 committees per slot. It's one committee per shard => 64 shards total.
Q1: One block proposer per shard per slot, drawn from the shard committee (64 committees => 64 shards). A separate single block proposer per slot for the beacon chain.
Q2: Yes.
Q3: Voting != proposing. Every shard generates one block every slot when things are running correctly.
Q4: 64 shards working in parallel. Each shard is "fatter" than Eth1 in a sense. Eth1 processes about 3KB data per second; Eth2 will process between 1 and 4 MB per second. That's where the ~1000x comes from. An older design had 1024 slimmer shards, but that has been deprecated. 64 fatter shards now.
